body_content.explanation: (of a perfomer, actor, etc.) when appearing in a film, on a TV show, etc., rather than in real life :
examples: The two actors have amazing chemistry on-screen.
Onscreen, she is full of surprises.
I didn't want to have my first kiss on screen.

body_content.explanation: on the screen, so that the people who are watching or looking at the screen can see :
examples: Children often copy what they see on-screen.
You can use the device to scan the image and reproduce it on screen in an electronic format.

body_content.explanation: used for describing a performer, actor, etc. when they are appearing in a film, on a TV show, etc., rather than in their own life:
examples: Her on-screen husband is also her partner in real life.
Is the on-screen rivalry between the brothers real?

body_content.explanation: appearing on the screen, so people watching or looking at the screen can see:
examples: Some programmes have an onscreen sign language interpreter.
